quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Minnesota and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, players, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which athlete on a Minnesota team is nicknamed The Big Ticket?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Garnett

questions.question: The Minnesota Wild are Minnesotas first National Hockey team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the real name of professional wrestler Kelly Kelly?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbara Blank

questions.question: The Minnesota Twins have produced four American League MVPs--Zoilo Versalles (1965), Harmon Killebrew (1969) and Rod Carew (1977) are three of them. Name the fourth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Justin Morneau

questions.question: Which of these NBA teams originated in Minnesota?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles Lakers

questions.question: Who was the first African American NFL quarterback?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willie Thrower

questions.question: Is Michael Hickenbottom the real name of the professional wrestler known as Shawn Michaels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which statement is true about major league baseball pitcher Danny Graves?

options.text: He was the first MLB player to toss a shutout in his first three  games.
He was the first major leaguer from Vietnam.
He was the first major leaguer from New Zealand.
He was the first major league pitcher to hit a grandslam home run in his first MLB game.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first major leaguer from Vietnam.

questions.question: Who was the first major league baseball player from Japan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Masanori Murakami

questions.question: On September 17, 1948 Greenbay played Boston in an NFL game. What was the significance of the game?

options.text: It was the first time a NFL game that went into overtime.
It was the first time a penalty flag was thrown.
It was the first time an interception was returned for a touchdown.
It was the first NFL game to be on radio.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the first time a penalty flag was thrown.

questions.question: Minnesota has a National Lacrosse League team called the Minnesota Wasps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Womens National Basketball Association (WNBA) has a team in Minnesota--the Minnesota Lynx.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Many  major league baseball players  are from the Dominican Republic. Who was the first major leaguer from the Dominican Republic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzie Virgil

questions.question: Ken Kennedy is the real name of the professional wrestler nicknamed Mr. Kennedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What are the two years the Minnesota Twins won the World Baseball Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1987  1991

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Basketball and Ring
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, gregory, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The standard size of a NBA basketball court is 94 by 50 ft (29 by 15 m.)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the size in circumference of the standard NBA basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 29 1/2 to 29 3/4 (74.9 to 76.8 cm)

questions.question: There should be 2 referees in a basketball game according to the NBA rules.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the real name of professional wrestler Jeff Hardy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jeff Hardy

questions.question: Which of the following is not among the many ways of getting a lane violation in basketball?

options.text: On a free throw when you cross the line before the shooter has shot
On a free throw when the shooter crosses the free throw line before the ball hits the rim
On defense when you are in the key for more than three seconds not guarding someone
When you stand in the key on offense for more than three seconds

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On defense when you are in the key for more than three seconds not guarding someone

questions.question: What is the real name of the professional wrestler known as the Boogeyman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Wright

questions.question: What is the distance between the free throw line and the front of the rim in a standard basketball court?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14.9 ft

questions.question: In basketball, the standard dimensions of the little box on the backboard are 25 by 15 in (63 by 38 cm.)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Is professional wrestler Gregory Shane Helms known by the ring name Shane Helms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Victoria Varon is the real name of the professional wrestler going by the ring name Victoria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Trevor Rhodes is the real name of the professional wrestler known by the ring name Trevor Murdoch.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1984, FIBA introduced to basketball regulations the three-point line. What is its length from the center of the basket?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 20 ft 6 in (6.25 m)

questions.question: In basketball, is picking up your dribble and taking two steps considered a travel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Was the standard basketball hoop ever lower or higher than 10 feet (3 m) throughout the history of basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: At the end of the 2006 season, Dale Earnhardt, Jr. was a 3-time champ in the Busch Series Racing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Dale Earnhardt and Jr.
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, clubs, jr.s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the book co-written by Dale Earnhardt, Jr. documenting his rookie season?

options.text: My Life as a NASCAR Driver

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Driver #8

questions.question: Dale Earnhardt, Jr. has an automotive degree.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Many Spanish sport clubs are named Real. What does it mean in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Royal

questions.question: The Philadelphia 76ers are a basketball team. What does 76 represent?

options.text: The age of Danny Biasone when he founded the team
1976, the year in which the club was established
The amount of money (in thousands) the teams founders had
1776, the year the Declaration of Independence was signed

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1776, the year the Declaration of Independence was signed

questions.question: African national football teams usually have a nickname. Which countrys footballers are known as Bafana, Bafana (The Boys)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: The nickname Dream Team is most often associated with which team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USA, basketball

questions.question: From 2000-2007, Dale Earnhardt, Jr. drove for what famous sponsor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Budweiser

questions.question: Dale Earnhardt, Jr. won his first NASCAR Cup Series race at which track in 2000?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: Dale Earnhardt, Jr. has a sister, half brother and half sister. What are their names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kelley, Kerry and Taylor

questions.question: London football clubs usually bear the name of the district their stadium is located in. Which of these teams is not based in London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aston Villa

questions.question: What is Dale Earnhardt, Jr.s real first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ralph

questions.question: Detroit is the capital of the US automotive industry. The Detroit basketball team is named after what car parts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pistons

questions.question: What is the collective nickname of  Dale Earnhardt, Jr.s friends from his hometown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dirty Mo Posse

questions.question: Which team is known as All Blacks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Zealand, rugby

questions.question: Dale Earnhardt Jr.s first stock race car was a 1979 Monte Carlo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nba and Season
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, rookie, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first NBA player to win the Finals MVP award in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry West

questions.question: Who was the first NBA player to win MVP, All Star MVP, and Finals MVP in the same season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willis Reed

questions.question: Who was the first African-American to play in an NBA game in 1950?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earl Lloyd

questions.question: Which city is home of Panathinaikos Sport Club?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athens

questions.question: Which two teams played in the first NBA game in 1946?

options.text: New York Knicks and Boston Celtics
Philidelphia Warrior and New York Knicks
New York Knicks and Toronto Huskies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Knicks and Toronto Huskies

questions.question: The Celtic and The Rangers are rival clubs from which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glasgow

questions.question: Bayern is a top German football team located in Munich. What is the meaning of its name?

options.text: It is an adjective form of Bayer, a German pharmaceutical company.
It is the German name of Bavaria, the region Munich is capital of.
It commemorates Johann Bayer, a German astronomer.
It means Beer Drinkers in local dialect.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the German name of Bavaria, the region Munich is capital of.

questions.question: Bob Petit won the first NBA MVP award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who scored the first basket in the first NBA game in 1946?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ossie Scechtman

questions.question: Who was the first woman drafted to the NBA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ann Meyers

questions.question: Who was the first NBA player to average a triple double for an entire season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Robertson

questions.question: National teams of which country are known in most sports as squadra azzura (blue team)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italy

questions.question: Who won the first NBA Championship in 1947?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philadelphia Warriors

questions.question: Which Canadian club dominated the NHL during the 1980s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmonton Oilers

questions.question: Who was the first NBA player to win Rookie of the Year and MVP in the same season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wilt Chamberlain

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nba and New York Mets
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, cubs, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Originally drafted by the Detroit Tigers, this baseman joined the New York Mets in 1997 just for one game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Morgan

questions.question: Although the New York Mets drafted this right hander in 1978, he was 29 years old by the time he made his major league debut in 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick Anderson

questions.question: In 1979, this Boston Celtics player scored the first 3 point basket in the NBA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Ford

questions.question: Which 68 reliever played for the New York Mets during the 1992 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Vitko

questions.question: Who was the first player to score 20,000 career points?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Pettit

questions.question: This spare outfielder came to the Mets on June 15, 1977 as part of the infamous Tom Seaver trade with the Reds. He hit only .230 in four seasons at Shea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan Norman

questions.question: Who was the first repeat winner of the slam dunk contest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jordan

questions.question: This catcher was traded to the Mets by the Cubs in 1986 for starting pitcher Ed Lynch.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Liddell

questions.question: Oscar Robertson is the first and only player to lead the NBA in scoring and assists in the same season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which 20-year-old first baseman made his debut for the New York Mets during the 1974 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brock Pemberton

questions.question: Who was the first center to lead the NBA in assists for a season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wilt Chamberlain

questions.question: Which of these players was a pinch running specialist for the 1992 New York Mets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rodney McCray

questions.question: This infielder came to the New York Mets from the Dodgers in December 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ross Jones

questions.question: Who was the first NBA player to record a quadruple double in a game (double digits in 4 stat categories)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nate Thurmond

questions.question: Who won the first NBA slam dunk contest in 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry Nance

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Ted Williams and Nickname

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Hrabosky

questions.question: After Ted Williams retired from play, he went on to manage what major league team?
